org.gearvrf

Class GVRMeshEyePointee

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVREyePointee
        • org.gearvrf.GVRMeshEyePointee
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GVRMeshEyePointee
extends GVREyePointee
    An actual eye pointee. A GVREyePointee is something that is being pointed at by a picking ray. Eye pointees are held by eye pointee holders, which are attached to scene objects. The GVRPicker will return a GVREyePointeeHolder[]: you use GVRComponent.getOwnerObject() to retrieve the scene object.

    A MeshEyePointee holds the GVRMesh that the picking ray will be tested against.

      • GVRMeshEyePointee

        public GVRMeshEyePointee(GVRContext gvrContext,
                         GVRMesh mesh)
        Constructor. When the mesh is complicated, it will be cheaper - though less accurate - to use GVRMesh.getBoundingBox() instead of the raw mesh.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRContext used by the app.
        mesh - The GVRMesh that the picking ray will test against.
